Articles.Content:
hotmailcompany52, I've managed to get a lot of ships into space and I have two ships that will collide with the Mun's orbit at some point. I'm okay at getting ships into orbit, but I'm no good at getting them to meet up and dock together and stuff like that, so I don't know how to make space stations and stuff like that.

(By the way, I really hope this is the right thread to be posting stuff like this, it's just you guys seemed to know what you were doing)

I dont thats the thing! XD

Anyway...I would recomend looking at Scott Manly's tourtorial about redavousing and docking.

Also, what day is my go?
June 5th i think.....

Got the cupola on.

With a large docking port at the side.

I'll post the file soon.

Edit: https://sites.google.com/site/giggleplex777/downloads/persistent.sfs?attredirects=0&d=1

Edited May 25, 2013 by Giggleplex777

Day not the date I meant.

Also shall i put up a coppla module up on the eve and duna space station?

Edited May 25, 2013 by hotmailcompany52

Yeah sure!

Ok Nutt007 you're up!

One thing I've never understood is how to get Space Planes into space. Once I've got them to a certain height in the atmosphere they become oxygen starved so they coast along for a while then begin to fall and only regain control once they've got to a low enough altitude. Is there an oxygen capsule in the Utilities section or something for air breathing engines to work in space?

For the record, I tried Googling this and the answers weren't helpful.

[EDIT] I managed to get a ship into orbit around the Mun! But there's not enough fuel left to land on it :/

Edited May 29, 2013 by Lunarzius

One thing I've never understood is how to get Space Planes into space. Once I've got them to a certain height in the atmosphere they become oxygen starved so they coast along for a while then begin to fall and only regain control once they've got to a low enough altitude. Is there an oxygen capsule in the Utilities section or something for air breathing engines to work in space?

For the record, I tried Googling this and the answers weren't helpful.

[EDIT] I managed to get a ship into orbit around the Mun! But there's not enough fuel left to land on it :/

Spaceplanes use both Jets and Liquid fuel engines.

On the image posted above I don't see any liquid fuel rockets on the spaceplane unless they aren't visible from the angle.

Am I just mistaken? Because it does seem necessary that liquid fuel rockets are needed.
he hid them in the engine.
How'd you guys get so good at this? ._.

On the image posted above I don't see any liquid fuel rockets on the spaceplane unless they aren't visible from the angle.

Am I just mistaken? Because it does seem necessary that liquid fuel rockets are needed.

look again. He has the tall liquid fuel + oxidizer tank near the front ofthe plane. I don't see his engines though.
Can I be signed up? I have a heavy Minmus [possibly Mun, haven't tested] rover, eight medium wheels, crewtank, and a cupola to drive from.
ok added....
Is it my turn yet?
yep your go!

Created a staion called JSS (Jebediah Space Station)

"[JASA] JSS" is the vessel name

I will post the persistent later

This is a proof of concept for my Minmus heavy rover:

http://s21.postimg.org/fm7qij93b/screenshot71.png
heey i like it!
Speaking of Minmus, I've got a concept for a rover of my own (significantly lighter than Red Dwarf's, though). I'll play around with that idea in my own save tonight, just to see if it works.
Given how well that rover went, I may make an even larger one.
Specialist290 you are up!

Alrighty. Grabbing the persistent file now.

EDIT: Is the Aircraft Fueler supposed to be right next to the Sun? I have a sneaking suspicion that it isn't...

Edited June 2, 2013 by Specialist290
Are there pilots willing to fly for engineers? I've designed a few things that I know can reach orbit, but I'm garbage at getting things in orbit and docking.

Alrighty. Grabbing the persistent file now.

EDIT: Is the Aircraft Fueler supposed to be right next to the Sun? I have a sneaking suspicion that it isn't...

Wait, what? I have to see this for myself...

EDIT: Its not next to the sun, its ON the sun.

Edited June 2, 2013 by zekes
Wait, WHAT!?
